title: Pak IDs, chocolates: 3 killed in Op Mahadev were Lashkar operatives behind Pahalgam attack
content: Security agencies have confirmed that the three terrorists killed after the Pahalgam attack were Pakistani nationals, providing irrefutable evidence including government documents and biometric data. The Lashkar-e-Taiba operatives were responsible for the April 22 attack that claimed 26 lives. Recovered items and forensic analysis further solidify Pakistan's direct involvement in the deadly incident.

title: Meat twice a month, Rs 540/per day: What awaits Prajwal Revanna in Bengaluru prison
content: Prajwal Revanna, formerly earning Rs 1.2 lakh monthly as an MP, now faces a stark reality as inmate no. 15528 in Bengaluru Central Prison, where his potential earnings are capped at Rs 540 per month. Awaiting his work assignment, he will adhere to prison routines, including a fixed menu and limited phone calls and visitation.

title: 'True Indian won't make such statement': SC slams Rahul over Army remark
content: The Supreme Court criticized Rahul Gandhi for his alleged defamatory remarks against the Indian Army, stating that a true Indian wouldn't make such statements. While staying the defamation case, the court questioned Gandhi about the basis of his claim that China occupied 2000 km of Indian land.

title: Cockroaches found in San Francisco-Mumbai Air India flight; airline apologises
content: Air India has initiated an investigation following passenger complaints about cockroaches on flight AI180 from San Francisco to Mumbai. The incident, which occurred during the long-haul journey, prompted the airline to relocate affected passengers and conduct a thorough cleaning during a scheduled stop in Kolkata. Air India has apologized for the inconvenience and is working to prevent future occurrences.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook confirms: Majority of new iPhones sold in US 'made' in India
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: Malegaon blast verdict: Shankaracharya says 'don't link terrorism with colour'
content: The acquittal of all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case has reignited the debate over the term 'Saffron Terror.' Shankaracharya Swami Avimukteshwaranand Saraswati Maharaj condemned linking color with terrorism, emphasizing that a terrorist is simply a terrorist. Political figures have weighed in, with some rejecting the term while others suggest alternatives like 'Hindu fundamentalist' or 'Hindu terrorism.'

title: Watch: 20-foot-long whale killed after boat collision; passenger thrown overboard
content: A tragic incident occurred in Barnegat Bay. A boat struck a minke whale on Saturday. The impact fatally injured the whale. A passenger was thrown into the water. The Marine Mammal Stranding Center responded to the scene. Authorities plan to move the whale for a necropsy. The incident sparked concern on social media.

title: ‘They’ll take us to Bangladesh’: Kolkata man hangs self over 'NRC-SIR' anxiety
content: Dilip Kumar Saha, a 63-year-old man who migrated from Bangladesh to Bengal in 1972, was found dead at his home. His family alleges that Saha's extreme anxiety over NRC and SIR led him to suicide, fueled by fears of being deported.

title: Talent wars: Many top engineers of Meta are joining my AI company xAI, and I am paying them...
content: Elon Musk claims his AI startup, xAI, is attracting Meta engineers without exorbitant salaries, emphasizing its merit-based culture and growth potential. This comes amid reports of Meta's aggressive AI talent acquisition, fueled by CEO Mark Zuckerberg's push to build a top-tier team for its Superintelligence Labs.

title: 'Education only way': Kamal Haasan's plan to defeat 'Sanatan, dictatorship'
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kamal Haasan emphasized the importance of education as the key to dismantling "dictatorship and Sanatan" during an Agaram Foundation event in Chennai. He cautioned against relying on other methods, asserting that education is essential for true victory, as an uninformed majority could undermine progress.

title: Congress MP R Sudha's chain snatched in Delhi during morning walk
content: Congress MP R Sudha was robbed of her gold chain during a morning walk in Delhi's high-security Chanakyapuri area. The incident occurred near the Poland Embassy, raising concerns about safety in the national capital. Sudha sustained injuries and expressed shock over the attack, urging authorities to apprehend the culprit immediately.

title: 'You get 30 days to...': Trump aide Steve Bannon slams H1-B visa holders
content: Steve Bannon has consistently criticized the H-1B visa program, advocating for its complete overhaul and stricter regulations on foreign students. He proposes exit visas for international graduates and accuses tech companies of exploiting the program to displace American workers. JD Vance has echoed these concerns, highlighting instances where companies lay off domestic employees while simultaneously seeking H-1B visas.

title: Rajasthan police’s public parade: Heads shaved, made to wear salwar suits
content: In Rajasthan's Merta, three men accused of swindling an elderly man were paraded through town dressed in women's clothing, chanting admissions of guilt. This public shaming tactic, increasingly used by Rajasthan police against organized and financial crimes, aims to deter potential offenders and reassure the public.

title: Woakes could bat with one arm against India – just like Malik in '86
content: In a dramatic turn at The Oval, injured Chris Woakes has declared himself available to bat for England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy's final day. Despite a painful shoulder injury, Woakes is prepared to bat at No.11 if needed to secure the remaining 35 runs for a series victory against India.

title: China resists US pressure to curb Russian, Iranian oil buys
content: US and China are engaged in tough trade negotiations, with a major sticking point being China's oil imports from Iran and Russia. China insists on maintaining its energy supply routes, defying US pressure to cease these purchases. Despite this disagreement, both sides express optimism about reaching a deal to stabilize commercial ties, although significant challenges remain.

title: IND vs ENG | Vaughan: 'If Stokes is injured in the future, Pope can stay as vice-captain'
content: Michael Vaughan suggests Harry Brook as a potential future England Test captain, impressed by his natural leadership qualities displayed on the field. Vaughan believes Brook could be a better fit than current vice-captain Ollie Pope, even though Pope is a great support to the captain. Brook's prior experience captaining England's white-ball team further strengthens Vaughan's argument.

title: Colon cancer rising in young adults; US doctor lists 4 fruits to cut risk
content: Recent studies highlight a concerning rise in colon cancer among younger adults, prompting experts to emphasize preventive lifestyle changes. Consuming fruits like watermelon, apples, kiwi, and citrus, rich in fiber and antioxidants, can significantly reduce the risk. Alongside a plant-rich diet, regular exercise, weight management, and limited alcohol intake are crucial for prevention.

title: IND vs ENG Test: 'He reminded me of Rishabh Pant' - Ex-India cricketer
content: Ajay Jadeja lauded Harry Brook's impactful batting style, drawing comparisons to Rishabh Pant due to their similar aggressive approach and the tendency for their bats to fly. Brook's aggressive innings, featuring a rapid scoring burst and a century, shifted the momentum for England.

title: NSDL IPO allotment today: How to check status, key dates- All you need to know
content: NSDL's Rs 4,011.60-crore IPO witnessed overwhelming investor response, oversubscribed 41.02 times and priced at Rs 800 per share. With listing scheduled on BSE, grey market premiums indicate a strong debut. The IPO, an Offer for Sale, aims to unlock shareholder value, attracting significant interest due to NSDL's strong financials and market position.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Monday is a workday...' –Ex-cricketers lambast match officials
content: Nasser Hussain and Dinesh Karthik have criticized match officials for halting play early on Day 4 of the fifth Test at The Oval. England, at 339 for 6, needed 35 more runs to win, while India required four wickets to draw the series. Hussain questioned why the umpires didn't offer an extra half-hour, potentially allowing for a thrilling finish.

title: Former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren passes away
content: Shibu Soren, 81, was a prominent tribal leader and founder of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM). Shibu Soren served as chief minister of Jharkhand three times, in March 2005 (for just 10 days from March 2 to March 11), August 27, 2008 to January 12, 2009, and from December 30, 2009 to May 31, 2010.

title: Exclusive | 'Very surprising': Indian World Junior Champ's Grand Swiss entry has a wild backstory
content: In a surprise twist, India’s 2025 World Junior Champion Pranav Venkatesh has earned a wildcard entry to the prestigious 2025 FIDE Grand Swiss after defeating Kazakhstan’s GM Kazybek Nogerbek 1.5–0.5 in an unpublicised 'Asian Wildcard Match' in Al Ain, UAE. Pranav, who narrowly missed qualifying by rating, now joins an elite field chasing a spot in the 2026 Candidates.

title: Ex-RCB player Mills joins OnlyFans, reveals his plans: 'Really excited'
content: Tymal Mills, formerly a fast bowler for Royal Challengers Bengaluru, has broken new ground by launching an OnlyFans account, clarifying it will focus on cricket and lifestyle content, not adult material. Mills aims to connect directly with fans, offering insights into the life of a cricketer beyond the usual media soundbites.

title: Shah Rukh Khan replies to Shashi Tharoor; says he wouldn't have understood ‘magniloquent’ words
content: Shah Rukh Khan, Bollywood's beloved 'Badshah', has received his first National Award for his stellar performance in the blockbuster 'Jawan'. Politician Shashi Tharoor congratulated him, and SRK responded with his signature wit. Khan expressed gratitude, acknowledging the long-overdue recognition and thanking the jury, government, family, and fans for their unwavering support.

title: Brooke Hogan’s husband: Hulk Hogan showed no interest in meeting grandkids
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: Taylor Swift’s Kelce jacket inspires Kristin Juszczyk’s new NFL line
content: Kristin Juszczyk, the designer, is launching a new NFL collection. This follows Taylor Swift's viral moment in a custom jacket. The collection celebrates fan culture and team loyalty. It features Chiefs-themed items like corsets and tees. Juszczyk acknowledges the support from Chiefs Kingdom. She credits Swift and Brittany Mahomes for boosting her career.

title: Dak Prescott builds new mansion, reveals why he razed the last one
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott is rebuilding his Texas mansion in Prosper, aiming for a more contemporary and intimate design. Construction began after he demolished his previous multi-million-dollar estate in October 2024. The new structure, featuring clean lines and compartmentalized segments, appears to be a luxurious, multi-story residence.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the rate outlook for August 4 week
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices have experienced volatility due to global trade uncertainties and President Trump's tariff announcements. Despite an initial dip following a US-EU trade deal, gold recovered after weaker-than-expected US non-farm payrolls data. Investors should monitor USDINR movements, as any upside could further support domestic rallies. Technically, gold on COMEX could see some upside from current levels.

title: Rs 95 crore: HCLTech’s Vijayakumar is highest-paid Indian IT CEO
content: HCLTech CEO C Vijayakumar became the highest-paid Indian IT CEO, earning Rs 94.6 crore in FY24-25, driven by strong company performance. His compensation saw a 7.9% increase, while the average employee hike was 3.1%. The Board approved a 71% remuneration hike for Vijayakumar, recognizing his leadership and HCLTech's growth, despite challenging market conditions.

title: Harvard rejects $500 million deal with Trump, says academic freedom is non-negotiable
content: Harvard University President Alan M. Garber has denied reports of a $500 million settlement with the Trump administration, stating academic freedom is non-negotiable, according to The Harvard Crimson. The University continues legal action over frozen federal research funding, while peer institutions like Columbia and Brown have already settled. Internal opposition has grown amid fears of policy concessions. Garber’s comments suggest Harvard may pursue a full legal resolution before considering any form of settlement.

title: ‘A for Akhilesh, D for Dimple’: SP neta teaches political slogans to students
content: Farhad Alam, an SP functionary, faces charges for allegedly running an illegal 'PDA Pathshala' in Saharanpur. He is accused of teaching children political slogans referencing SP leaders instead of standard curriculum, sparking outrage. The FIR was filed after a complaint alleged the politicization of education, leading to police investigation and legal action.

title: PM Modi strikes defiant ‘Make in India’ note in face of Trump’s tariff
content: Amidst global economic instability and US tariff threats, Prime Minister Modi has strongly advocated for boosting domestic consumption, emphasizing the 'Make in India' initiative. Despite US pressure, India hasn't halted Russian oil imports, prioritizing its economic interests. India defends its long-standing ties with Russia, asserting independent foreign policy.

title: 'Now I love her ad': Trump on finding out Sydney Sweeney is registered Republican
content: Donald Trump praised Sydney Sweeney's American Eagle jeans ad after learning she is a Republican, despite controversy surrounding the campaign. The ad, featuring Sweeney discussing genetics and wearing blue jeans, faced backlash for perceived connections to eugenics. American Eagle defended the campaign, stating it was solely about the jeans and celebrating individual style.

title: IND vs ENG: Siraj could be remembered for costly drop - Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain believes Mohammed Siraj's costly missed catch of Harry Brook, who was at 19, might overshadow his otherwise stellar performance in the series. Brook capitalised, scoring a century, shifting the momentum towards England.

title: HC stays conviction of vax scientist for wife's suicide; cites 'national interest'
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has suspended the conviction of vaccine scientist Dr. Akash Yadav, who was found guilty of abetment to suicide in connection with his wife's death in 2015. The court acknowledged Yadav's crucial role in public health and national immunization efforts, stating that his conviction hindered his ability to contribute to vaccine programs.

title: India financing Russia's war, says Trump's aide
content: A senior Trump administration official, Stephen Miller, has criticised India for its continued purchase of Russian oil, asserting it fuels the Russia-Ukraine war. Miller highlighted the surprising scale of India's oil imports from Russia, nearly matching China's. This rebuke follows the imposition of tariffs on Indian goods and warnings of further penalties if oil purchases continue without a peace agreement.

title: 'Mistreated, missed my flight': Army officer files FIR against SpiceJet
content: An Army officer is under investigation after allegedly assaulting SpiceJet employees at Srinagar airport for enforcing baggage rules. The incident, which included serious injuries to staff, led to a police FIR and a viral video.

title: ‘Didn’t want him to meet wife, kids’: Woman stabs live-in partner to death in Gurgaon
content: In Gurgaon, Yashmeet Kaur was arrested for allegedly murdering her live-in partner, Harish. Police investigation revealed Harish was married with children. The incident occurred after a dispute. Harish wanted to return to his family. Kaur disapproved of his visits home. This led to a fatal argument. Police recovered a knife and T-shirt from the crime scene in DLF Phase 3.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Oval thriller goes to the wire! India hang by a thread
content: England's Harry Brook and Joe Root mounted a fierce counterattack, scoring centuries and turning the Oval into a battleground. India's Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna fought back, claiming crucial wickets to keep India in contention. With the series hanging in the balance, India needs four wickets on the final day to secure a 2-2 draw.

title: IND vs ENG: R Ashwin slams Gill and Gambhir - 'In today's day and age...'
content: R Ashwin has criticized Shubman Gill's captaincy and Gautam Gambhir's coaching during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, citing a "lack of game awareness." Ashwin pointed out missed opportunities to utilize spinners effectively, particularly Washington Sundar, which he believes contributed to England's advantage.

title: Man falls off moving train, loses leg in 'phatka gang' phone snatching
content: A 22-year-old farmer, Gaurav Nikam, suffered a partial leg amputation after a 'Phatka gang' attack near Kalyan while traveling on the Tapovan Express. A minor struck Nikam, causing him to fall from the train, and then robbed him of his phone and cash. Kalyan GRP apprehended the 16-year-old accused from Irani Pada, a known crime hotspot.

title: CHESS | Gukesh laud Divya's World Cup win - 'It is not easy...'
content: India's chess prowess shone at the Women’s World Cup, where Divya Deshmukh secured a remarkable victory, inspiring fellow players like Gukesh. He emphasized the importance of success in both men's and women's chess for India, expressing excitement for the upcoming World Cup to be hosted in India.

title: 'India treats players like superstars, while USA sabotages theirs': Niemann
content: Hans Niemann sparked controversy by contrasting India's robust support system for chess players with the alleged shortcomings of the American chess federation. This followed Divya Deshmukh's historic FIDE Women’s World Cup win, celebrated with significant government recognition and financial rewards in India. Niemann suggests the diverging approaches will have clear consequences for chess talent development in the coming years.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Test cricket needed a series like this' - Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain praises the feisty Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, highlighting memorable moments and the competitive spirit between the teams. He appreciates the series' watchability and impact on Test cricket. However, Hussain criticizes the pitches for being too batting-friendly and the inconsistent scheduling with odd gaps between matches, suggesting a more balanced approach.

title: Musk’s Neuralink: How it helps paralysed patients and aims to merge humans with AI
content: Elon Musk's Neuralink is making waves with its brain-computer interface. The 'Link' implant allows paralysed patients to control devices with their minds. Noland Arbaugh and Audrey Crews are among the early recipients. They are regaining digital independence. Neuralink envisions future applications like memory enhancement and brain-to-brain communication. The technology faces ethical and safety challenges.

title: How Bijan Robinson and Christian McCaffrey are forming a competitive bond
content: Along with Luke McCaffrey, the players shared tips about performance and recovery during offseason workouts.

title: NFLPA elects White as interim executive director
content: The NFL Players Association on Sunday night elected David White as its interim executive director, 17 days after the resignation of Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Young wins elusive 1st PGA Tour title at Wyndham
content: Cameron Young finally got his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after seven runner-up finishes, coasting to a 2-under 68 to win the Wyndham Championship.

title: Lyles stare-down, Bednarek shove cap tense 200m
content: The U.S. track championships turned physical Sunday, with Noah Lyles and Kenny Bednarek getting involved in a shoving and shouting match as they crossed the finish line of a hotly contested 200-meter final.

title: Miami says Messi injury 'minor,' no return date set
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi suffered a "minor" muscle injury in his right leg Saturday night in the Leagues Cup match against Necaxa at Chase Stadium.

title: Khabib hopes McGregor changes 'how he is living'
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Fins make Sieler their highest-paid defensive player
content: The Dolphins and defensive tackle Zach Sieler agreed to a three-year extension worth up to $67.75 million, making him the team's highest-paid defensive player.

title: Rodriguez makes history with another 20-20 year
content: Julio Rodriguez homered to become the first player in major league history with 20 or more home runs and 20 or more stolen bases in each of his first four seasons.

title: Amorim backs Fernandes' criticism of 'lazy' United
content: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has backed Bruno Fernandes' criticism of the performance in their 2-2 draw with Everton by saying he's happy for his players to call it out if they see a drop in standards.

title: 🏈 Making sense of Terry McLaurin's trade request
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued
content: The annual hit is back, with players Eric Karabell feels are going earlier than they should in fantasy football drafts.

title: NBA fact or fiction: Was Draymond right about the end of free agency?
content: Did the CBA ruin NBA free agency? Bobby Marks plays "fact or fiction" with some of the offseason's most impactful trends.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Ruben Amorim Q&A: 'It's Manchester United; we need to return to Europe'
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim talks to ESPN about changing the club's culture, Alejandro Garnacho's future, and exchanging GIFs with Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review
content: Arsenal's preseason tour featured the arrival of a new star striker and the emergence of a bright prospect.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: Current pick right up where they left off
content: The NWSL is back from its summer break, and Kansas City Current haven't skipped a beat. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Ramos as Sesko backup
content: Newcastle could turn to PSG's Gonçalo Ramos if their pursuit of Benjamin Sesko stalls. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Arsenal still open to Eze deal
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could get done?

title: South Carolina to Illinois: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 6 quiz
content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season
content: We used past performance, future expectations, in-game decision-making and more to rank coaching staffs.

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era
content: The uncertainty surrounding how programs will pay players is directly affecting the timeline for high school prospects.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Free Palestine: WikiLeaks’ Julian Assange joins thousands in march
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: A Year After Uprising And Sheikh Hasina's Fall, Bangladesh Still Far From Reform
content: A year on, Bangladesh is still reeling from that violence, and Hasina now faces trial for crimes against humanity in absentia, as she is in exile in India.

title: "Was Scared, Shivering": IndiGo Flier Slapped During Panic Attack
content: Hussain Ahmed Majumdar, a resident of Assam, suffered a panic attack when he was travelling from Mumbai to Silchar via Kolkata on Thursday.

title: Fake Passport Racket Busted: Akola Emerges As Key Hub For Afghan Network
content: In a twist to the recently busted inter-state fake passport racket, the communally sensitive city of Akola in Maharashtra has emerged as the fourth major hub of an Afghan-led network operating across Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, and Chhattisgarh.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Sends India-US Ties Back To The Drawing Board
content: For decades, the US had been striving to shed its perception in India as an unreliable partner. Now, in one fell swoop, Trump has reignited such questions.

title: Affair, Fake Case Threat: Madhya Pradesh Family's Mass Suicide
content: Investigation into the case revealed that the man, Manohar Lodhi's wife Draupadi, was having an affair with his childhood friend, Surendra.

title: Video: Hungry Elephant Blocks Road, Searches Multiple Trucks For Food
content: A dramatic scene unfolded in Odisha's Sundargarh district when a hungry wild elephant brought traffic to a standstill by blocking several trucks on a remote forested road in search of food.

title: Video: Small Plane Crashes Into Ocean Near North Carolina, Pilot Survives
content: A small, single-engine aircraft made an emergency water landing in the ocean near Oak Island Pier late Saturday evening, prompting immediate rescue attempts that saved the only person on board - the pilot.

title: Kolkata-Bound Air India Express Plane Faces Tech Snag, Returns To Bengaluru
content: The flight IX2718 returned after being airborne for over two hours, according to information available on flight tracking website Flightradar24.

title: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Charter Plane Lands At Wrong Airstrip, Pilots De-rostered
content: The incident took place when Bhajanlal Sharma was travelling to Rajasthan's Phalodi from Delhi for an event.

title: Man Dies In Car-Bike Collision On Delhi's Parliament Street
content: A man died after an SUV rammed into his motorcycle in New Delhi's Parliament Street area on Monday morning, an official said.

title: 5 Unauthorised Flights Reported Near Trump Property Over Weekend
content: A civilian aircraft was intercepted by fighter jets on Sunday afternoon after it entered restricted airspace near Donald Trump's golf club in Bedminster, New Jersey.

title: "Empowered Tribal Community, Poor": PM Modi Leads Tributes To Shibu Soren
content: Tributes poured in from across the political spectrum on Monday following the death of Shibu Soren, former Jharkhand Chief Minister, and the founder of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM).

title: Smoking Increases Risk Of Spinal Disc Damage, Doctors Warn
content: Doctors at the North Eastern Indira Gandhi Regional Institute of Health and Medical Sciences (NEIGRIHMS) here have warned that smoking significantly increases the risk of developing a slipped disc, also known as lumbar disc herniation.

title: 20 Peacocks Found Dead In Karnataka, Weeks After Tigress, 4 Cubs Died
content: The carcasses of 20 peacocks - three male and 17 female - were found by farmers, scattered in farmland located beside a stream.

title: "India Is Valued Friend": Philippines President Embarks 5-Day State Visit
content: Philippines President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr. on Monday described India as a "valued friend" as he embarked on a five-day State Visit to India.

title: Anti-Terrorist Operation Continues For 4th Day In J&K's Kulgam
content: It's day four of a protracted gun battle between security forces and terrorists in the forests of Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district.

title: The End Of Mumbai's Kabutarkhanas: History, Health Risks, Opposition
content: On July 31, the Bombay High Court ordered the closure of all kabutarkhanas in Mumbai, saying they posed a threat to public health.

title: Government IDs, Biometric Data Nail Pahalgam Terrorists' Pakistan Links
content: The three Pahalgam terrorists, who were killed during Operation Mahadev in Jammu and kashmir's Kashmir's Dachigam on July 28, were Pakistani nationals and senior operatives of terror outfit Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

title: Drunk Army Officer Hits 30 People With Car In Nagpur, Then This Happens
content: Officials said the army officer was driving recklessly and lost control of the vehicle. Within seconds, he hit people, the car overturned and fell into a drain.

title: How Washington beat the odds -- and its past -- to return to RFK
content: Washington Commanders owner Josh Harris addressed reporters after striking one of the biggest deals in recent franchise history . Harris wore the expression of an athlete who had just won a big game . he grew up a fan of the team he bought from previous owner Dan Snyder for $6.05 billion in 2023 .

title: What were the Twins thinking? Who is MLB's team to beat? Making sense of the trade deadline's biggest surprises
content: the 2025 trade deadline is in the books . the San Diego Padres and Houston Astros made surprising moves that rocked the deadline . ESPN experts debate what's real moving forward . there's no team to beat in the American League, Bradford Doolittle says .

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: CFP 2025: 32 teams can make the College Football Playoff
content: the 12-team college football playoff will again include the five highest-ranked conference champions . there are 32 teams -- the most in the CFP era -- with at least a 10% chance of reaching the playoff . the list will shrink by November, but below it starts with 32 teams ranked in order of their percentage chance .

title: How McLaren's split strategies helped Norris upset Piastri
content: the battle of the McLarens between lando Norris and Oscar Piastri has sparked a heated debate . a battle between the two drivers had come within centimeters of a collision on the penultimate lap of the Hungarian Grand Prix . the battle was the same: i've always promised to allow its drivers to race, and i think it's a good race!

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers: What we loved -- and don't understand
content: this year's deadline didn't have star players on the move, like Juan Soto in 2022 . 68 trades on deadline day went down with a flurry of activity . the Astros traded closer Mason Miller to the Padres for leo de Vries .

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what’s next
content: quarterback dak Prescott and receiver ceeDee Lamb didn't get their respective new deals done until close to the season . on friday, parsons posted on social media that he is requesting a trade . "i no longer want to play for the Dallas Cowboys," he wrote .

title: Supreme Court to hear T.N. plea against HC order barring it from using name, picture of CM Stalin in welfare schemes
content: Senior advocate Mukul Rohatgi, appearing for the Tamil Nadu Government, said it has been held by the Supreme Court that the name and pictures of the CM can be used in welfare schemes

title: India, Philippines stage joint sail and naval drill in the disputed South China Sea
content: Armed Forces of the Philippines chief of staff Gen. Romeo Brawner said the two-day joint naval sail and exercises have been successful so far and expressed hopes that Filipino forces could engage India’s military in more joint maneuvers

title: Odisha motor vehicle inspector arrested for corruption; 44 plots, 1 kg gold, among valuables found
content: Golap Chandra Hansdah, working at the RTO in Boudh, was arrested after assets disproportionate to his known sources of income were found in his possession, they said

title: SIR very big issue, government must agree to debate: Priyanka Gandhi
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked why the opposition should not continue to raise the issue when the matter pertains to voters' list.

title: Absurd to link SIR in Bihar with Tamil Nadu, says Election Commission
content: A post by ECI, seeking to check facts in light of the charges made by former Union Minister P. Chidambaram, said, there was no need for political leaders to spread “false information” with respect to the SIR exercisce being conducted at the national level

title: Karnataka ranks second in EV charging stations on national highways
content: According to data by Ministry of Road Transport & Highways, a total of 4,557 public EV charging stations have been installed across 146,342 km stretch of National Highway across India

title: Takeaways for India from Trump moment: strategic autonomy is alive, neoliberalism is dead
content: Neither obsequiousness nor confrontation can advance India’s relations with the U.S. India should also learn that soft power is supposed to be soft, not loud and screeching

title: Rajya Sabha adjourns for the day as a mark of respect to Shibu Soren’s death
content: Deputy Chairman Harivansh announced Shibu Soren’s death in the Upper House immediately after it convened for the day, and the members observed a minute of silence to mark his death

title: Delivery worker fatally knocked down by private bus at Kalamassery in Kerala
content: He was reportedly on duty and was on his way to pick up a delivery for an online aggregator when his motorcycle was knocked down by private bus

title: Delhi Police’s description of Bengali an insult to language in which national anthem was written: Stalin
content: Ms. Banerjee had stated that a purported communication by the Delhi Police had reportedly referred to Bengali as a “Bangladeshi language”

title: Rahul Gandhi defamation case: Supreme Court stays proceedings; issues notice to State of Uttar Pradesh, complainant
content: “How did you get to know that 2,000 sq km of Indian territory was occupied? Were you there? Do you have any credible proof?” Justice Dipankar Datta criticised Rahul Gandhi

title: 678th Bahmani empire foundation day celebrated in Kalaburagi
content: Sultan Alauddin Hasan Bahman Shah established his capital, Ahsanabad (now Kalaburagi), on August 3, 1347

title: Shibu Soren’s death: Jharkhand Assembly Monsoon Session adjourned sine die
content: Legislators inside the Assembly raised slogans such as ‘Shibu Soren Amar Rahe’ (Long live Shibu Soren) as soon as the House assembled for the day

title: Uttar Pradesh floods: 'Failed' government focussed on event management than public welfare, says Akhilesh Yadav
content: In a post on X, the former Chief Minister said when the State Government can organise "super VVIP" rallies, why has it failed to carry out relief and rescue operations in the flood-affected areas

title: BJP's ally IPFT demands SIR in Tripura
content: The development came days after a delegation of Tipra Motha Party (TMP), another ally of the BJP in Tripura, met Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Gyanesh Kumar and demanded SIR in the State

title: 43-year-old woman ends life in Hyderabad apartment complex
content: Police recover three letters purportedly written by the victim, one of them mentioning religious customs

title: 22-year-old man arrested for marrying minor, sexual assault in Raichur
content: According to the girl’s statement, the accused committed sexual assault on her twice at his house, despite knowing that she was a minor

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 11 LIVE: Rajya Sabha adjourned for the day to mark Shibu Soren’s death; Lok Sabha adjourns after Opposition protest
content: Rajya Sabha adjourned for the day after convening, as a sign of respect after the demise of Shibu Soren

title: Shibu Soren, JMM founder and former Jharkhand CM, dies at 81 after prolonged illness
content: Shibu Soren was admitted to the Sir Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital and was in life support following an illness

title: Eight militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested five active cadres of KCP (PWG) from different locations in Imphal West and East and Bishnupur districts

title: Man held at Mumbai airport with marijuana worth ₹14.73 cr concealed in 'diplomatic' cargo
content: The contraband was concealed in a packet labelled as "Diplomatic Pouch of Ministry of External Affairs (MEA)"

title: How will the railway to Sairang help in regional connectivity? | Explained
content: How will it boost the Act East policy? What is the status of projects to link the northeast with Southeast Asia?

title: Odisha self-immolation case: Crime Branch of Odisha police arrests two persons linked to the death
content: The death had then raised serious questions about existence of internal complaint committees mandated under Internal Committee mandated under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013

title: Body of Puri girl brought to Odisha from Delhi
content: The minor's body reached the Biju Patnaik International Airport here before being taken to her native place at Balanga in Puri district, amid tight security arrangements

title: PM Narendra Modi to inaugurate Namma Metro Yellow Line on August 10, lay foundation for Phase 3
content: The Yellow and Orange Lines together will benefit nearly 25 lakh people in Bengaluru South, according to Bangalore South MP Tejasvi Surya

title: Naidu urges Gadkari to give speedy clearance to Vizag and Vijayawada metro rail projects
content: Thanking the Union Minister for sanctioning new road projects costing ₹27,000 crore, the Chief Minister promises to ensure land acquisition issues do not hamper their execution

title: BJP committed to uplift of denotified tribes, says Andhra party president Madhav
content: Stating that these marginalised communities have been subjected to neglect for long, the BJP leader highlights the measures taken by the NDA government at the Centre to restore their identity and dignity

title: Quartz mining brings political rivalry to the fore in Nellore district
content: While TDP MP Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy terms the allegations as baseless, YSRCP leader Anil Kumar sees attempt to corner him politically

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Fins' Tyreek Hill making hustle plays, rebuilding rapport with teammates
content: DL Warren Brinson is enjoying a training camp . the team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . we have updated depth charts for all 32 teams . ari | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | DAL | DEN | DET | GB | HOU | IND JAX | KC | LAC | LAR | LV | MIA | MIN NE | NO | NYG | NYJ | P

title: Family alleges NRC fear behind elderly man’s death in Kolkata
content: The deceased worked as a non-teaching staff member at a private school in south Kolkata. He had arrived in Kolkata in 1972 from Nawabganj in Dhaka

title: Top Trump aide accuses India of financing Russia's war in Ukraine
content: The criticism of India by Stephen Miller, deputy chief of staff at the White House, was one of the strongest yet by the Trump administration

title: Another slip up by India in the trade pact with the U.K.
content: There is a dilution of India’s backing of the more effective compulsory licensing to address the high prices of patented medicines

title: On the track towards belonging
content: More than a feat of engineering, completion of the line is a reaffirmation of a social contract between the people of Kashmir and the Indian Union

title: While in power AIADMK surrendered T.N.’s autonomy by backing Centre’s policies: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleges that the BJP-led government at the Centre allocated meagre funding to Tamil, the first language in India to be recognised as a Classical Language, while allocating several crores of rupees for Sanskrit

title: Delete caste column from appraisal forms: T.N. Police Commission
content: The panel, headed by former Judge of the Madras High Court Justice C.T. Selvam and other senior serving and former bureaucrats, says there is no need for the superior officer appraising the professional work to know the caste of the police personnel

title: Using ‘Bangladeshi for Bangla’ an insult to Bengali culture: Trinamool
content: The Trinamool Congress has been calling for Bengali Asmita over the targeting of migrant workers in BJP ruled states

title: Despite nod from officials, motorable road is still on paper for tribespeople in Marayur
content: Karimutty tribal settlement is just 350 m away from the Munnar-Udumalpet National Highway. There is only a dirt road connecting the NH to the settlement, despite multiple petitions from the tribespeople

title: Philippines President Marcos Jr. to visit India as two sides deepen maritime cooperation
content: President Marcos Jr. will hold delegation-level talks with Prime Minister Modi with the two sides signing multiple agreements and MoUs

title: Two doctors assaulted at hospital in Tripura’s Agartala; police inaction alleged
content: On-duty medical staff targeted by patient’s attendants; protest over repeated attacks and lack of accountability

title: Press Club of India seeks withdrawal of FIR against journalist in Himachal Pradesh
content: Press Club says action against reporter, portal for reposting victim’s account undermines press freedom

title: Promoters of Ozone Urbana in Bengaluru diverted project funds, says ED
content: Evidence with respect to double sale of a few flats has also been gathered and seized during the course of investigation, ED stated

title: 58,000 personnel to be inducted in CISF over next five years, as Centre expects new industrial hubs in Maoist-affected States
content: President sanctions enhancement in CISF authorised ceiling strength, from 2 lakh to 2.2 lakh; present strength is 1.62 lakh; CISF official says about 14,000 to be recruited per year over next five years

title: Thousands march in silent rally in Kolhapur, demanding return of elephant Mahadevi by NGO Vantara
content: The Bombay High Court on July 16 had allowed the relocation of the elephant to Vantara’s facility in Gujarat, noting that the elephant had been kept in solitary confinement and was reportedly in poor health

title: Prajwal Revanna assigned prisoner number 15528
content: The former MP will have to work for eight hours a day and can choose among working at the bakery, carpentry, gardening, animal husbandry, or crafts.

title: Opposition rejects Odisha Police claim in minor girl’s death in Puri
content: State unit of Congress warns of a gherao of the office of the Director General of Police if no action was taken within seven days

title: Comprehensive policy for Malayalam film industry within 2-3 months: Saji Cherian
content: Two-day Kerala Film Policy Conclave concludes. Minister says government has taken serious note of the issues raised by the junior artistes about their abject working conditions

title: Residents of Bengaluru’s Balagere protest over lack of basic civic infrastructure
content: Despite several complaints to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, there had been no action to rectify the situation

title: Forensic technique to identify Prajwal Revanna in video evidence used for first time in Karnataka
content: The Special Court for MP/MLAs has appreciated the probe carried out by the SIT for “their limpid examination in adopting and utilising the modern technology of scientific examination”, terming it a “welcome step”

title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan courts controversy at Kerala Film Policy Conclave, Minister counters him
content: He calls for providing training to SC/ST and women filmmakers whose movies are funded by the government and to reduce the amount to ₹50 lakh from the present ₹1.5 crore

title: CPI(M) and Congress accuse BJP of claiming credit for the nuns’ release to score political brownie points
content: Schisms seemed to develop in the Church leadership over the question of whether the BJP national leadership had genuinely come to the aid of the nuns, as the party has claimed.

title: NDA seeks legal action against Tejashwi Yadav for allegedly holding two Voter ID cards
content: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the EPIC number cited by the RJD leader at a press conference was different from the one referred to by the ECI to refute his claim

title: Joshi says Rahul’s electoral malpractice charge is baseless
content: He should approach Election Commission of India if he has any evidence, according to the Union Minister
